member.name: CXAPOBase.CXAPOBase
member.summary: Creates an instance of the CXAPOBase class.
member.param: Pointer to an structure containing the registration properties for the XAPO.

member.name: CXAPOBase.GetRegistrationPropertiesInternal
member.summary: Returns a pointer to the structure containing the registration properties the XAPO was created with.

returns.para: Pointer to the structure containing the registration properties the XAPO was created with.

member.name: CXAPOBase.IsLocked
member.summary: Queries whether the XAPO is locked.
member.returns: Returns TRUE if the XAPO is locked for processing; otherwise returns FALSE.

member.name: CXAPOBase.ProcessThru
member.summary: Called by an implementation when an XAPO is disabled for thru processing.
member.param: Pointer to a buffer containing the input audio data.
Pointer to a buffer that will contain the processed audio data.
Number of frames of audio data to process, where a frame is a block of samples, one per channel of audio data.
Number of channels in the input data buffer.
Number of channels in the output data buffer.
TRUE to mix with the destination buffer, FALSE to overwrite the destination buffer.

member.name: CXAPOBase.ValidateFormatDefault
member.summary: Verifies that an audio format falls within the default ranges supported.
member.param: If TRUE indicates that pFormat should be overwritten with the nearest audio format supported if the format it specified is not supported. The nearest audio format is determined by bit depth, framerate and channel count in that order of importance.
member.returns: Return S_OK if the audio format is supported. Returns XAPO_E_FORMAT_UNSUPPORTED if the audio format is unsupported, pFormat will be overwritten with the nearest audio format if fOverwrite is TRUE. Returns E_INVALIDARG if the audio format is invalid, in which case pFormat will be left untouched.

member.name: CXAPOBase.ValidateFormatPair
member.summary: Verifies that an input and output format pair configuration is supported by the XAPO.
member.param: An audio format known to be supported by the XAPO.
An audio format to examine, must be a pointer to a WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE structure if fOverWrite is TRUE.

If TRUE indicates that pRequestedFormat should be overwritten with the nearest audio format supported if the requested format is not supported. The nearest audio format is determined by bit depth, framerate and channel count in that order of importance.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if the format pair is supported. Returns XAPO_E_FORMAT_UNSUPPORTED if the format pair is unsupported; pRequestedFormat will be overwritten if fOverWrite is TRUE. Returns E_INVALIDARG if either audio format was invalid; pRequestedFormat will be left untouched.
